sub_title: Data Governance, Master Data Management, Data Management Strategist, Data Quality Specialist, Data Storyteller | Driving Data Quality Programs saving $64M
summary:
I am a data professional who loves to connect with people via storytelling

With the early understanding of my analytical skills and expansive knowledge of data, I dedicated the entirety of my academic and career pursuits toward honing these areas, establishing a resounding career of over 16 years spanning data management and managing projects lifecycles from initial conceptualization to handover.

As an advocate for continuous improvements, change management is another area that I specialize in, showcasing my ability to optimize, improve and restructure the data management function. 

My key qualities include my ability to identify multi-million-dollar cost savings within existing processes, design innovative strategies that resolve data-related risks and problems, and deliver large-scale projects that optimized efficiencies, reduce delays, and improve engagement. 

💥💥 A Few Key Achievements:

✅ Managed annual enterprise data management activities, involving data quality enhancement affecting >700 FTEs and annual cost reduction of $2.5M

✅ Planned, Designed, and Implemented an Automated Data Quality Validation process that enhanced data mining by 40% and prevented a potential loss of $64M in revenue

I hold skills that have been naturally progressive for me, such as training employees in several countries, continually modernizing the data management function and its processes, and strengthening stakeholder relations across multiple regions.

I love fishing 🎣, data 📊, stories, and public speaking🚣‍♀️, so reach out for consulting on the next catch of breaking data technology story 😉. 

I can be contacted ☎️ directly via any means listed in my contact info

awards.issuer: VP Enterprise IT Strategy and Planning - Shell

awards.title: Second best Speaker in the Netherlands 2017
awards.description:
Toastmasters International is a USA headquartered nonprofit educational organization that operates clubs worldwide for the purpose of helping members improve their communication, public speaking, and leadership skills
Why Should You Join Toastmasters?
Everyone has their own personal reasons for joining Toastmasters, but here are a few of the most common:

1-Become a Better Public Speaker
Members work through a series of educational programs (at their own pace) designed to improve their ability to write speeches, design presentations, and deliver them.

2- Overcome Public Speaking Fears
The most positive and supportive audience in the world is a Toastmasters club audience. Speaking regularly in front of a group helps you calm your nerves and communicate effectively.

3- “Practice” Presentations for Other Audiences
Everyone has different motivations for wanting to speak better. Maybe you want to hone your presentation skills for your career. Perhaps you want to be able to speak out in your volunteer organization. Maybe you want to complement your portfolio as an author, manager, or other professional with speaking gigs? Whatever the case, Toastmasters is a wonderful laboratory for you to practice your presentations and gain valuable feedback.

4- Gain the Confidence and Courage to Lead
Leadership and communication skills are intimately bound. Some might argue that leadership is nothing more than the ability to effectively communicate a vision. As your communication skills improve, your ability to lead will improve as well.

profile_positions.description:
• Contributed to the development of the data governance and data quality practice at Schiphol, advancing the data management strategy and goals.
• Promoted business awareness of data processes and provided pragmatic application advice.
• Functioned as a Subject Matter Expert in a specific Schiphol business domain, taking charge of metadata curation, data issue resolution, and data quality improvement.
• Supported data owners with domain-specific knowledge and drive, acting as a crucial liaison between business processes and data processes.
• Implemented data policies and principles and created data awareness within the business domain.
• Leveraged subject matter expertise in the Schiphol business domain to take charge of metadata curation, data issue analysis and resolution, and data quality improvement.
• Bridged the gap between business and data processes, effectively identifying, measuring, analyzing, and resolving data quality issues in collaboration with business stakeholders.
• Played a crucial role in structurally measuring, reporting, and enhancing data quality.
• Implemented data policies and principles organization-wide, raising data awareness and fostering a data-driven culture.
profile_positions.title: Data Management Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•	Develop, plan, and manage a Data Quality program, including data quality assessment.
•	Gather data quality requirements, develop rules, and implement monitoring.
•	Plan, build, and execute data quality training for business Data Stewards, Data Engineers, and Data Governance specialists, ensuring processes and methods are understood.
•	Play a key role in working with various stakeholders across the organization to achieve the goals defined in the data quality, governance, and data management strategies.
•	Champion the application, usage, and adoption of data quality capabilities out of Enterprise Data Analysis -EMEA.
•	Own the continuous improvement of enterprise data governance & quality capabilities. Define the north star, strategy & roadmap for each product & deliver value drops.
•	Assess the effectiveness of data quality enhancement work within different teams.
•	Advise and participate in working groups relating to the Data Governance program.
•	Provide one-to-one coaching with a network of Data Stewards and Data Custodians, ensuring Data Quality concepts are well understood and adhered to.
profile_positions.title: Data Quality Specialist

company.name: Shell -SHELL INTERNATIONAL EXPLORATION AND PRODUCTION B.V.

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements:
•	Pivotal role during design and delivery of an in-house 12-week virtual learning program (>3,300 hours) for the Application & Data community of 400 aimed at developing EPIC business and delivery partners in response to the COVID-19 pandemic; increased soft skills proficiencies by 10%, partner confidence by 18% and a 4.7*/5 experience score.
•	Led annual seismic data capture and storage project ($2.5m) that reduced data quality gaps affecting >700 FTEs.
•	Introduced new geophysical tools and delivered training to end-users, such as Exploration Archives (seismic index tool) and Oasis-Bridge which enables geoscientists and explorationists to discover and retrieve key seismic data.
•	Reduced costs (65%), lead times (-4 days), and improved quality (34%) by leading a large-scale seismic data quality project in 2019, with ownership in project planning, requirements gathering, leading audits, and implementation.
•	Reduced data mining time by 40% via leading of a seismic metadata improvement project encompassing updating of the master metadata database, and extraction of additional attributes; delivered within tight deadlines.
•	Spearheaded design and delivery of a data quality dashboard to monitor and report on subsurface data quality.
•	Designed new requirements and workflow procedures to optimize existing seismic corporate data systems. 
•	Led offshoring services team remotely in India, delegating tasks, managing service delivery, conducting in-house data management training courses, developing team members, and providing as a mentor in-person and remotely.
•	Oversaw establishment of SLAs and contract negotiations with major clients on providing data delivery services.
•	Led tape transcription programs and BG data ingestion while enforcing all data-related policies and procedures.
profile_positions.title: Senior Subsurface Data Management Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements:
•	Designed and delivered a data exchange medium in collaboration with government bodies and stakeholders, to ensure all data security, obligations and entitlements were in place, and regular review to evaluate placement.
•	Increased productivity, operational efficiencies for the technical support team via conceptualization, designing, and implementation of new internal processes, resulting in a significant improvement in the team’s organizational impact.
•	Ownership in resolving escalated data management and exploration support issues, and mitigating clients’ concerns.
•	Key player in areas such as quality control, data archiving optimizations, solution design, datastore implementations, data storage, flow management, governance, due diligence, driving compliance, and population of metadata.
•	Contributed to the management of a sustainable exploration environment that allowed discovery, providing as an advisor to the subsurface exploration and field development communities on all subsurface data loading services.
•	Utilised technical data management principles and analytical strengths in processing and navigating seismic data, to drive exploration and field development feasibility studies and research.
•	Global networking and effective sharing of subsurface data management best practices, providing as a resource.
profile_positions.title: Subsurface Data Management Consultant, Shell International, Libya

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements:
•	Essential role during a seismic borehole data management project by leading writing procedures and workflow.
•	Conducted advanced seismic process filtering and multiples attenuation methods to assess and evaluate data for both Perth and Tripoli offices by producing in-depth reports encompassing data management and support areas.
•	Established and strengthened relations with key stakeholders including contractors and senior geophysicists, facilitating communication lines to ensure timely updates on project progress and to address data concerns.
•	Maintained seismic and well data loading and management activities, including updating of SEGYS and navigation files and well logs to enable up-to-date information for easier management reference and decision making.
profile_positions.title: Data Management & Application Support Lead, Woodside NA, Libya

profile_positions.description:
The Libyan Branch of Dietsmann Group manages a $45million maintenance contract for the Mellitah Complex Gas Plant, which processes the natural gas and condensate produced from the Wafa Desert Gas Plant and the Sabratha Offshore Platform.

• Managed the Documentation System and oversaw the Documentation Process relating to the purchase of repairs and capital expenditure items ranging from €50,000 through to €1/2million.

• Liaised closely with the engineers to go on site and inspect items supplied, compiling and submitting results and findings by the testing teams and engineers to project management.

• Oversaw the process for archiving and storing of documents.

Key milestones and achievements:

• Led a team of 3 people (A Programmer & 2 assistances) to develop an indexing system by using MS Excel VBA
profile_positions.title: TECHNICAL DOCUMENTATION MANAGER

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements:
•	Co-established a thriving adult training center, set up to deliver IT and English Language training programs, with full involvement in designing internal processes, procedures, roadmaps, frameworks, workflow, and related policies.
•	Designed, and delivered informative and engaging IT training programs to a wide range of professional levels.
•	Interviewed, recruited, and on-boarded new employees to ensure maximized understanding of key objectives.
•	Showcased financial management skills via budget allocation, expense control, and identifying saving approaches.
•	Successfully acquired high-value government contracts via the ability to conduct complex negotiations effectively.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder, Africa Training Centre, Libya

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Libya Job Expo invites you to participate in this economically driven, social, and cultural event as an integral part of the social responsibility of each public and private sector.
This exhibition aims to create jobs and is suitable for job seekers at all levels and examines opportunities to support and strengthen the capacities and talents of job seekers. It also helps them to be able to cope with the demands of career and national development challenges.
Through active participation in this unique expo, public and private institutions can provide the greatest number of jobs within the local market support. This will give the opportunity to help build Libya with much greater skills, qualifications, and varied experiences.
Hence the fact Libya has a great percentage of high unemployment, Libya Job Expo is a perfect chance to gain a look at different job opportunities offered. Even if you can not get a career, you will at least have a better picture of what is required from you to achieve and also to identify and communicate directly with the labor market currently available and in the future
